com.oracle.truffle.api.debug

Class ExecutionEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oracle.truffle.api.debug.ExecutionEvent
  • Deprecated. 
    Use Debugger.startSession(SuspendedCallback) instead to step into the next execution.

    @Deprecated
public final class ExecutionEvent
extends Object
    This event is delivered to all registered event handlers when an execution is about to be started. The event is the intended place to initialize debugger - e.g. set breakpoints or specify to execution should halt on the first possible occurrence. Methods in this event can only be used while the handlers process the event. Then the state of the event becomes invalid and subsequent calls to the event methods yield IllegalStateException. One can however obtain reference to Debugger instance and keep it to further manipulate with debugging capabilities of the PolyglotEngine when it is running.
    Since:
    0.9

    • Method Detail

      • getDebugger

        public Debugger getDebugger()
        Deprecated. 
        Debugger associated with the execution. This debugger remains valid after the event is processed, it is possible and suggested to keep a reference to it and use it any time later when evaluating sources in the PolyglotEngine.
        Returns:
        instance of debugger associated with the just starting execution and any subsequent ones in the same PolyglotEngine.
        Since:
        0.9

      • prepareContinue

        public void prepareContinue()
        Deprecated. 
        Prepare to execute in Continue mode when guest language program execution resumes. In this mode:
        • Execution will continue until either:
          1. execution arrives at a node to which an enabled breakpoint is attached, or:
          2. execution completes.
        Since:
        0.9

      • prepareStepInto

        public void prepareStepInto()
        Deprecated. 
        Prepare to execute in StepInto mode when guest language program execution resumes. In this mode:
        • User breakpoints are disabled.
        • Execution will continue until either:
          1. execution arrives at a node with the tag representing halt or:
          2. execution completes.
        • StepInto mode persists only through one resumption (i.e. stepIntoCount steps), and reverts by default to Continue mode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified number is <= 0
        Since:
        0.9
